"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \displaystyle \dfrac{\sum_{i=1}^{2015} \dfrac{x}{x - a_{i}}}{2015} \geq \dfrac{2015x}{2014x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^{2015} (\dfrac{x}{x - a_{i}} -1)  \geq \dfrac{2015}{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relevant wiki: Factorials Problem Solving - Intermediate","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First we can find the number of trailing zeros of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Which is 502. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lfloor \dfrac{2015}{5}\rfloor + \lfloor \dfrac{2015}{25}\rfloor + \lfloor \dfrac{2015}{125}\rfloor + \lfloor \dfrac{2015}{625}\rfloor = 502"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Now Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2015!}{5^{502}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{M}{2^{502}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".We want to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N \pmod{1000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let's start with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M \pmod {1000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which can be reduced to the separated calculus of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M \pmod 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M \pmod {125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" thanks to Chinese Remainder Theorem. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
We can notice that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2015!}{5^{502}}=1\times2\times3\times4\times1\times6\times7\times8\times9\times2\times11\times12\times13\times\ldots"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M \pmod 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is obviusly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\equiv 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so now we have to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M \pmod {125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There is a nice pattern in that, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1\times2\times3\times4 \equiv 6\times7\times8\times9 \equiv \ldots \equiv 24 \pmod{125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". So we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24^{403}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (there are 403 repetition), now we can notice that we have the same pattern repeted for those factors which are in the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". So There are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24^{80}\times 401\times402\times403"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" <--the last 3 terms are "extra" so we have to count them apart. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Now there is the same pattern for those terms "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^2k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so there is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24^{16}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , then for those terms "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^3k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" there is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24^{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and at the end we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1\times2\times3\times16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which is the last pattern with 3 factor of the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^4k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the last factor "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". How rewriting everything we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24^{403}\times24^{80}\times24^{16}\times24^{3}\times31\times6\times16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" using properties of powers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24^{502}\times31\times6\times16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and we have to calculate it "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\pmod{125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and using "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\phi(125)=100"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24^2\times101"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that can be easily calculate and it is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"51\pmod{125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Applying CRT we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases} M \equiv 0 \pmod 8 \\ M \equiv 51 \pmod{125} \end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M\equiv 176 \pmod{1000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
About "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{502}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It is thanks to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\phi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\equiv 4 \pmod {125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and applying CRT to calculate last 3 digits we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases} 2^{502} \equiv 0 \pmod 8 \\ 2^{502} \equiv 4 \pmod{125} \end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". So it is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"504"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Now "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{M}{2^{502}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be rewritten as  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{176}{504} \pmod{1000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Applying another time CRT  we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases} \dfrac{176}{504} \equiv 0 \pmod 8 \\ \dfrac{176}{504} \equiv \dfrac{51}{4} \pmod{125} \end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For the second one we can multiply by 4 obtaining "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4X \equiv 51 \pmod{125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"inv_{125}(4)=94"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" <--we can obtain it solving an easy diophantine "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4j-125k=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"94\times4X \equiv 94\times51 \pmod{125} \implies X\equiv 44 \pmod{125}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Last thing is to solve this CRT system:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{cases} X \equiv 0 \pmod 8 \\ X \equiv44 \pmod{125} \end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And the solution is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X\equiv 544 \pmod{1000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let’s define the function: A(n) which removes all trailing zeros from n. Example: A(120) = 12, A(1200003) = 1200003 and A(46900) = 469 and so on. 
We want to find (A(2015!)) mod 1000."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let’s also define D(0) = 1 X 2 X 3 X 4 X 6 X 7 X 8 X 9, D(1) = 11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16 X 17 X 18 X 19, D(2) = 21 X 22 X 23 X 24 X 26 X 27 X 28 X 29, and in general:
D(n) = (10n + 1) X (10n + 2) X (10n + 3) X (10n + 4) X (10n + 6) X (10n + 7) X (10n + 8) X (10n + 9)
It can easily be shown that: D(n) mod 1000 = D(n mod 1000) "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since 2015! = 1 X 2 X 3 X 4 …. X 2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014 X 2015. Let’s separate the multiples of 5 together."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015! = (1 X 2 X 3 X 4 X 6 X 7 X 8 X 9) X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16 X 17 X 18 X 19) X … X
(2001 X 2002 X 2003 X 2004 X 2006 X 2007 X 2008 X 2009) X (2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014 X 
(5 X 10 X 15 X 20 X 25 X 30 X … X 2000 X 2005 X 2010 X 2015)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015! = D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(200) X (2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014) X
(5 X 10 X 15 X 20 X 25 X 30 X … X 2000 X 2005 X 2010 X 2015)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015! = D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(200) X (2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014) X
5^403 X (1 X 2 X 3 X 4 X 5 X … 403)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015! = D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(200) X (2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014) X
5^403 X 403!    (1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the same way, we can develop 403!
403! = D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(39) X (401 X 402 X 403) X
5^80 X 80!    (2)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the same way, we can develop 80!
80! = D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(7) X 5^16 X 16!    (3)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the same way, we can develop 16!
16! = D(0) X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) X 5^3 X 3!    (4)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From 1, 2, 3, 4 we get:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015! = (D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(200)) X (D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(39)) X (D(0) X D(1) X D(2) X … D(7)) X D(0) X 5^502 X (2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014) X (401 X 402 X 403) X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) X 6        (5)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let us define E(n) = D(n) mod 1000
E(n) = ((10n + 1) X (10n + 2) X (10n + 3) X (10n + 4) X (10n + 6) X (10n + 7) X (10n + 8) X (10n + 9)) mod 1000
E(n) = ((10n + 1) X (10n + 9) X (10n + 2) X (10n + 8) X (10n + 3) X (10n + 7) X (10n + 4) X (10n + 6)) mod 1000
E(n) = ((100n2 + 100n + 9) X (100n2 + 100n + 16) X (100n2 + 100n + 21) X (100n2 + 100n + 24)) mod 1000
E(n) = ((100n2 + 100n + 9) X (100n2 + 100n + 16)) mod 1000 X ((100n2 + 100n + 21) X (100n2 + 100n + 24) mod 1000) mod 1000
E(n) = ((500n2 + 500n + 144) mod 1000 X ((500n2 + 500n + 504) mod 1000) mod 1000
E(n) = 144 X 504 mod 1000 = 576         (6)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From 5 and 6:
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A((576 ^ (201 + 40 + 8 + 1) mod 1000 X 5^502 X (2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014) X (401 X 402 X 403) X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) X 6) mod 1000        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A(2015!) mod 1000 = A((576 ^ 250) mod 1000 X 5^502 mod 1000 X (2011 X 2012 X 2013 X 2014) mod 1000 X (401 X 402 X 403) mod 1000 X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) X 6) mod 1000       "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(376 X 5^502 mod 1000 X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14) mod 1000 X (401 X 402 X 403) mod 1000 X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) X 6) mod 1000        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(376 X 5^502 X 24 X (406) X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) X 6) mod 1000        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It can be easily shown that if n is a multiple of 8 then : (376 X n) mod 1000 = n mod 1000"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 24 X 406 X 6 X (11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16)) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 464 X 11 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 104 X 12 X 13 X 14 X 16) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 248 X 13 X 14 X 16) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 224 X 14 X 16) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 136 X 16) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 136 X 16) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 176) mod 1000     (11)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since 2^100 mod 1000 = 376 Then 2^600 mod 1000 = 376"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In 11:
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(5^502 X 176 X 2^600) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = A(10^502 X 176 X 2^98) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
A(2015!) mod 1000 = (176 X 2^98) mod 1000 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
Since 2^80 mod 1000 = 176, 2^10 mod 1000 = 24, 2^8 mod 1000 = 256, "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
2^98 mod 1000 = (176 X 24 X 256) mod 1000 = 344
A(2015!) mod 1000 = (176 X 344) mod 1000 = 544"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By using the property of definite integrals"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \displaystyle \int_a^c f(x) \,dx = \int_a^b f(x) \,dx + \int_b^c f(x) \,dx "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a<b<c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we can write down our integral as"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" I = \displaystyle \int_1^3 \left\lfloor x \right\rfloor \cos { \left( \frac { \pi }{ 2 } \left( x-\left\lfloor x \right\rfloor \right) \right) dx } = \int_1^2 \left\lfloor x \right\rfloor \cos { \left( \frac { \pi }{ 2 } \left( x-\left\lfloor x \right\rfloor \right) \right) dx } + \int_2^3 \left\lfloor x \right\rfloor \cos { \left( \frac { \pi }{ 2 } \left( x-\left\lfloor x \right\rfloor \right) \right) dx } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \le x < 2 \implies \left\lfloor x \right\rfloor = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 \le x < 3 \implies \left\lfloor x \right\rfloor = 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" I = \displaystyle \int_1^2 \cos { \left( \frac { \pi }{ 2 } \left( x-1 \right) \right) dx } + \int_2^3 \cos { \left( \frac { \pi }{ 2 } \left( x-2 \right) \right) dx } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Appropriate substitutions of "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{\pi}{2} (x-1) = u \implies \dfrac{\pi}{2} \,dx = du \\ \dfrac{\pi}{2} (x-2) = v \implies \dfrac{\pi}{2} \,dx = dv"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"yields"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} I &= \displaystyle \dfrac{2}{\pi} \int_0^{{\pi}/{2}} \cos u \,du + \dfrac{4}{\pi} \int_0^{{\pi}/{2}} \cos v \,dv \\
&= \dfrac{2}{\pi} \sin u {\huge |}_0^{{\pi}/{2}} + \dfrac{4}{\pi} \sin v {\huge |}_0^{{\pi}/{2}} \\
&= \dfrac{6}{\pi} \\
& \approx \boxed{1.90986} \end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

The value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\log_{3x}3y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be expressed in the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\frac ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive relatively prime integers. {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \log _{3x} { 3y } =  \log _{3x} { 3 }  + \log _{3x} { y } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{3x} { y } = \frac {2} {3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is given, we only need to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{3x} { 3 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{x} { 3y } = \frac {20}{13} \quad \Rightarrow 3y = x ^ {  \frac {20}{13} }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\log _{3x} { y } = \frac {2}{3} \quad \Rightarrow y = (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } \quad \Rightarrow 3y = 3 (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow  3y = x ^ {  \frac {20}{13} } = 3 (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow (3x) ^ {  \frac {20}{13} } = 3 ^ { 1+ \frac {20}{13} }  (3x) ^ { \frac {2}{3} } \quad \Rightarrow (3x) ^ {\frac {20}{13} - \frac {2}{3} } = 3 ^ {\frac {33}{13} } \quad  \Rightarrow  (3x) ^ {\frac {34}{39} } = 3 ^ {\frac {33}{13} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow (3x) ^ {\frac {34}{39} \times \frac {13}{33}  } = 3 \quad  \Rightarrow  (3x) ^ {\frac {34}{99} } = 3 \quad \Rightarrow \log_{3x} {3} = \frac {34}{99}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow  \log _{3x} { 3y } =  \log _{3x} { 3 }  + \log _{3x} { y } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\quad \quad = \frac {34}{99} + \frac {2}{3} = \frac{100}{99} = \frac {a}{b}\quad \Rightarrow a+b = \boxed{199}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

Semicircles with diameters "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{AB}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{AC}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" intersect at a point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AP=20"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle APB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3-4-5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" right triangle and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\triangle APC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20-21-29"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" right triangle."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos \angle BAP = \dfrac{20}{25}=\dfrac{4}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos \angle PAC = \dfrac{20}{29}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin \angle BAP = \dfrac{15}{25}=\dfrac{3}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin \angle PAC = \dfrac{21}{29}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Applying the Law of Cosines on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle BAC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives us:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BC=\sqrt{25^2+29^2-2\cdot25\cdot29\cdot\cos (\angle BAP+\angle PAC)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We also know that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos (\angle BAP+\angle PAC)=\cos\angle BAP\cos\angle PAC - \sin \angle BAP \sin \angle PAC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\quad\;\;=\dfrac{20}{25}\cdot\dfrac{20}{29}-\dfrac{15}{25}\cdot\dfrac{21}{29}=\dfrac{17}{145}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BC=\sqrt{25^2+29^2-2\cdot25\cdot29\cdot\dfrac{17}{145}}=\sqrt{1296}=\boxed{36}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Positive Divisors
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the least positive integers such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5m^{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4n^{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" each have exactly 2015 positive divisors. Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\frac { m }{ n }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set AMSP."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015=5\times 17\times 31=5\times 403=31\times 65=13\times 155"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By the "},{"type":"text","text":"theorem of divisors","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":", if any positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has exactly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" positive divisors, then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must have one of the following forms (where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p,q,r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are primes):"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=p^{2014}~\textrm{ or }~p^4q^{402}~\textrm{ or }~p^{30}q^{64}~\textrm{ or }~p^{12}q^{154}~\textrm{ or }~p^4q^{30}r^{12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is trivial to note that for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\{p,q,r\}=\{2,3,5\}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p^4q^{30}r^{12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives the smallest value among all the forms. Also, note that it satisfies both the conditions for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5m^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4n^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5m^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a prime and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5\mid 5m^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", one of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p,q,r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". To get integral value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and to minimize the value, take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"q=2,r=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". That leaves us with,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\min(m^3)=(5\cdot 2^{10}\cdot 3^4)^3\implies \min(m)=5\cdot 2^{10}\cdot 3^{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, similarly, we proceed for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4n^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4=2^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a prime, one of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p,q,r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Using the same motivation as before, we take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"q=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and to minimize the value, we take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p=5,r=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". That leaves us with,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\min(n^4)=(2^7\cdot 3^3\cdot 5)^4\implies \min(n)=2^7\cdot 3^3\cdot 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore\quad\frac{\min(m)}{\min(n)}=8\times 3=24"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If one wishes, he/she can test all the other forms too where all the problem conditions are fulfilled. But here, only this form gives the minimum values for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m,n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Armed with this information, lets look at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5m^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since we are raising "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3rd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power, we can include "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as part of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", because raising "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3rd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power then multiplying by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" again will give us our target exponent degree of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Next, lets take the smallest prime number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and raise it to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10th"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power. We use "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because we are looking for the least positive integer value for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and using "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" yields the lowest final product. Since we are raising "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3rd"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2^{10})^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will give us our target exponent degree of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"30"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Finally, we take the second smallest prime number, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and raise it to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4th"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{4^3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives us our final target exponent degree of 4.
"},{"type":"text","text":"Multiplying these factors together we know that m=210∗34∗5m = 2^10 * 3^4 * 5m=210∗34∗5.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can apply a similar process to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4n^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and find our value for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Our coefficient in this case is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Subtracting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" from our target exponent degree of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"30"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"28"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". So we raise "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7th"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" degree because when we take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{7^4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and add "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we reach "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"30"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
From here on we can straightforwardly take the next two prime numbers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and raise them to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4th"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1st"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" powers respectively. When raise to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3th"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" power they give us our final target degrees of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
"},{"type":"text","text":"Multiplying these factors together we know that n=27∗33∗5n = 2^7 * 3^3 * 5n=27∗33∗5.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The final step is simply to divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Most of the exponents cancel out and we are left with  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^3 * 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{24}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"
